DOC.brief_summary: This study compares the long-axis and short-axis technique of continues adductor canal block for total knee replacement surgery. Half participants will receive long-axis catheterization, while the other half will receive short-axis catheterization.
DOC.brief_title: Ultrasound-guided Continuous Adductor Canal Block for Analgesia After Total Knee Replacement: Comparison of Short-axis and Long-axis Techniques
DOC.criteria: 1880 years Kneearthroscopy Written consent ASA IIII BMI 1935 Unable to communicate in Danish Allergic reactions toward drugs used in the trial Pregnancy Abuse of alcohol/drugs Daily opioid intake Infection at injection site Can not be mobilised to 5 meters of walk; presurgery
